description.narrative: Local development actors have strengthened capacity to create a supportive environment for adolescents and youth to build competencies, employability, civic engagement and local environment management skills for their empowerment.UNDAF/Produit 8.1 : D'ici 2023, les collectivitÃ©s territoriales disposent de capacitÃ©s renforcÃ©es pour la mise en Å“uvre des plans de dÃ©veloppement local prenant en compte les femmes, les jeunes, les enfants et les groupes vulnÃ©rables ainsi que les dimensions environnementales et les changements climatiques, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most vulnerable families, children and adolescents (boys and girls) benefit from a gradual increase in social protection coverage, equity of access to basic social services in their communities and opportunities for empowerment and development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Local development actors have strengthened capacity to create a supportive environment for adolescents and youth to build competencies, employability, civic engagement and local environment management skills for their empowerment.UNDAF/Produit 8.1 : D’ici 2023, les collectivités territoriales disposent de capacités renforcées pour la mise en œuvre des plans de développement local prenant en compte les femmes, les jeunes, les enfants et les groupes vulnérables ainsi que les dimensions environnementales et les changements climatiques

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF has strengthened its work with Territories to reinforce the Child Friendly Territories (CFT) initiative and move forward its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) agenda to further integrate child rights issues into the businesses' operations, especially mining companies. Moreover, Territories has been trained in Results-Based Management (RBM) principles, gender mainstreaming in community projects. Substantial support has been provided to the CFT for the preparation of their Local Development Plans (LDPs) to enable CFT to have medium-term planning documents. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Nombre de plans de dveloppement local sensibles au genre et aux enfants labors
